titleInfo.title: WERE brought to the Police Prison of the Second Municipality

mods.abstract: WERE brought to the Police Prison of the Second Municipality, the following named Slaves, viz: HENRY, about 34 years of age; says he belongs to Mr. Collins. ANDERSON, about 40 years of age; says he belongs to Mr. Edward Chiffie. CHARLES, about 20 years of age; says he belongs to Mr. Mondelli. JACK, about 13 years of age; says he belongs to Mr. Creggs. MARIA, about 16 or 17 years of age; says she belongs to Mrs. Gormly. The owners of said slaves are requested to prove property, pay charges, and take them away. H S HARPER, Captain of the Night Watch. jy31
mods.note: Mr. Collins; Edward Chiffie; Mr. Mondelli; Mr. Creggs; Mrs. Gormly
Henry (34); Anderson (40); Charles (20); Jack (13); Maria (16 or 17)
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
